definition: to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard
surname Wei
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: When the crunch-card turns up, a bail-out card offers a way out.
sentences.chinese: 出現“緊縮”牌時，“保釋”牌排憂解圍。

sentences.english: I often think about Rosalyn and the way she turned to save me that day.
sentences.chinese: 我常常回想起羅莎琳和她那天給我解圍的情形。

sentences.english: Zola takes, Cordoba heads clear at the far post.
sentences.chinese: 對方角球，佐拉主罰，科爾多巴在遠端頭取解圍。

sentences.english: This is where flowcharts come to the rescue.
sentences.chinese: 這就需要流程圖來解圍了。

sentences.english: Ming secretly come to rong was caught by Cheng Lin men, and for the clearance.
sentences.chinese: 明偷偷來找蓉被程林手下抓住，蓉替其解圍。

sentences.english: Liz: Thanks for helping me out.
They won three corners all of which Drogba headed away.
sentences.chinese: 他們獲得了三個角球，但全數被德羅巴以頭球解圍。

sentences.english: The 60th minute, in Sun Xiang biography, but the Asian Touchy team breaks through.
sentences.chinese: 第60分鐘，孫祥傳中，但是亞塔奇隊解圍。

sentences.english: E.g. He always comes to my rescue whenever I get stuck.
sentences.chinese: 每次我遇到麻煩都是他幫我解圍。

sentences.english: One particular left-footed touch saw him pluck the ball from the air inside his own penalty area.
sentences.chinese: 一次左腳的大腳解圍將球踢出本方禁區。

definition: to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to stop/to obstruct
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
to console
lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
goalkeeper
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
(dialect) key/Taiwan pr. [suo3 shi5]
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to hit back/to return fire
fighting/killing
to move quickly/to vault/flying tackle
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
